<p>Do this question in R. It is just like the one on Assignment 0. \begin{parts} \part Read the data <span class="math inline">1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7</span> into a variable in R. Verify that your variable contains the correct values. (Hint: .)</p>
<pre><code>\begin{select}
\begin{solution}</code></pre>
<p>Call the variable whatever you like. I used . &lt;&lt;&gt;&gt;= w=c(1,2,3,4,5,7) w<br />
@</p>
<p>Top two lines in a Script window, echoed in the Console; bottom line in the Console. \end{solution}<br />
\end{select}</p>
<pre><code>\part Find the mean and the standard deviation of your variable.

\begin{select}
\begin{solution}
  Ask for them, one by one:</code></pre>
<p>&lt;&lt;&gt;&gt;= mean(w)<br />
@ and &lt;&lt;&gt;&gt;= sd(w)<br />
@</p>
<pre><code>\end{solution}
\end{select}</code></pre>
